channel.title: vim on pronvis.site
channel.description: Recent content in vim on pronvis.site

item.title: vim tips
item.description: Here I will place some vim tips to not to forget. Command promt <ctrl+r>" to paste yanked text to vim command prompt, link <ctl-r><ctl-w> to paste word under cursor to vim command prompt, link History q: to open vim history, it is possible to edit and search there like in normal mode, link Moving zt puts current line to top of screen, zz center, zb buttom, link Editing <ctrl+v> + <any_key> will insert “value” of a key, nice to have when editing vim config file <ctrl+a>/<ctrl+x> increment/decrement next number on line, works even with hexadecimal, or binary.
